DataElement.preferredName: Cytogenetic Abnormality Detection Karyotyping Method Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not cytogenetic abnormalities were detected via karyotyping.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.:The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

Concepts.definition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

Property.preferredDefinition: The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
